# What is the distinct function?

The distinct function is a simple yet powerful dplyr command that takes on an input of a data frame and removes all duplicate rows within it. Duplicates are defined as equal values in all columns.

## What package contains it?

The distinct function is part of the `dplyr` package, which is a concise grammar of data manipulation with an emphasis on high performance. It provides tools to work with data frame and tibbles.
